sourcerer package¶

sourcerer.base module¶

class sourcerer.base.Document(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sourcerer.base.Statement

All content is rooted in this base document

export()[source]¶
class sourcerer.base.Statement(code='', scope=None, whitespace='', line_ending='n')[source]¶

Bases: object

A line of code

A Statement is a line of code that may or may not have a child Scope

add_child(child)[source]¶

Append a child to this statements scope

Args:
child (Statement): The child to append
add_children(child_list)[source]¶

A convenience function to load multiple children into this scope

Args:
child_list (list): a list of children to append to this objects scope
build_renderer(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Overwrite this function to customize how render should be called for particular objects

create_lineage(lineage)[source]¶

Create a hierarchical lineage of children with this object as the oldest member. eg. children = [c1, c2, c3] result – self (top level)

|-> c1
|-> c2
|-> c3
format()[source]¶

Abstract function to format properties this object

from_lineage(lineage)[source]¶

Create a hierarchical list of parents with this object as the youngest decentant

Lineage will be arranged in the order the parents are provided. eg. parents = [p1, p2, p3] result – p1 (top level)

|->p2
|->p3
|->self

In this example the top level parent would be at scope level n+1 and this object would be at scope level n+4.

Args:
lineage (list): a hierarchical list of parents for this object.
from_parent(parent)[source]¶

Append this statement to a parents scope

Args:
parent (Statement): The aprrent to be appended to
generate()[source]¶

Abstract function to set self.code

render(level=-1, increment=1)[source]¶

Return this statement and all children recursively

Args:
level (int): The indentation level to set for this statement increment (int): The number of indentation levels for the child scope

sourcerer.callables.string_args(args)[source]¶

Enclose your positional arguments in strings so it can be used as an argument, rather than part of the arg spec.

Args:
args (list/string): A string/list of strings to be quoted

classmethod name(property)[source]¶

Replace all punctuation in a callables name with underscores

class sourcerer.formatters.Formatter[source]¶

Bases: object

Formatting operations for syntax objects

Name functions after the property they will be operating on. All function should take one argument of ‘property’.

classmethod apply(syntax_obj)[source]¶

Apply all formatters to the given object

This method will search the given syntax object for any property which has the same name as a formatter.

Args:
syntax_obj (object): The object with the attributes to be formatted
